roleset.name: label
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: (from call-v.01)
CALLING-N NOTES: Roleset based on BOLT P01 instances. Comparison to verb entry call.01. No FN for gerund. (from calling-n.01)

roles.note: Some of the trees only include arg1 and arg2 under a single S node. Contrary to regular rules, it is ok in these cases to dig into the syntax and label arg1 and arg2 separately. Don't try to cram them into a single argument.

example.name: call-v: with attribute
example.text: Mary called John an idiot

example.name: call-v: passivized
example.text: The worksheets were called 'Learning Materials'

example.name: calling-n
example.text: Still it is to me fairly obvious that his calling her "The Enchantress of Numbers" implies that she had a thorough knowledge of the subject.

roleset.name: summon, perhaps to or by phone
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: (from call-v.02)
CALL-N NOTES: (from call-n.11)
CALLING-N NOTES: Based on Comparison to verb entry call.02, which maps to 13.5.1. No FN for gerund. (from calling-n.02)

example.name: call-v: without benefactive
example.text: The bells called the faithful to evensong

example.name: call-v: with benefactive
example.text: John called a doctor for Mary

example.name: call-v: benefactive with double NP
example.text: John called Mary a doctor.

example.name: call-n: phone call
example.text: Her call to the pentagon was dropped when she went through a tunnel.

example.name: call-n: LV
example.text: Well , and then what happened was , we had a conference call.

example.name: calling-n
example.text: ...his calling the police for us.

roleset.name: demand
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: VN class 0rder-60. (from call-v.03)
CALL-N NOTES: Based on verb roleset call.03. (from call-n.02)
CALLING-N NOTES: Based on comparison to verb entry call.03, which maps to VN class 60, No FN for gerund. (from calling-n.03)

role.descr: demandee, of whom is arg1 being demanded?

example.name: call-v: reelection woes
example.text: Gore called for a recount.

example.name: call-v: without 'for'
example.text: Ford called a Jaguar stockholders' meeting.

example.name: call-n
example.text: European Union foreign policy chief Catherine Ashton has renewed her call for Yemen's president to give up power.
example.arg: for Yemen's president to give up power

example.name: call-n; all args
example.text: His call to the people for action was inspiring.

example.name: calling-n
example.text: We also know that he loathed cruelty and abuse of power; this led to his calling for more lenient laws against debtors.
example.arg: for more lenient laws against debtors

roleset.name: say across a distance
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: (from call-v.07)
CALL-N NOTES: (from call-n.01)
CALLING-N NOTES: Based on comparison to verb entry call.07, which maps to VN class 37.3. No FN. (from calling-n.04)

example.name: call-v: it gets worse
example.text: ``You people here think this is Russian music,'' she said with disdain, and called over to the waitress: ``Could you turn it off?''

example.name: call-n
example.text: She was gone then, her call goodbye to Billy echoed in Jacob's ears.

example.name: calling-n
example.text: Although it was belated, he heard her calling goodnight to him.

roleset.name: call into question, doubt
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: (from call-v.09)

example.name: call_up-v: is that so?
example.text: EC Agriculture Commissioner Ray MacSharry said the U.S. plan ``calls into question'' the agreement reached by world negotiators last April in Geneva seeking ``substantial progressive reductions in agricultural support and protection.''
example.arg: the agreement reached by world negotiators last April in Geneva seeking ``substantial progressive reductions in agricultural support and protection.''

roleset.name: prediction, decision
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: Modified by Kevin G., 2/11/09 (from call-v.10)
CALL-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb call.10. No appropriate VN class. Expanded by Julia. Includes a little bit of conceptual overlap with call-v.11. (from call-n.10)

example.name: call-v: a better example
example.text: The weather forecast calls for light rain this morning.

example.name: call-n
example.text: Nice Call on Tuesday's Weather!

example.name: call-n; All Arguments, LVC
example.text: Joe Bastardi makes his call on the '09 hurricane season.

example.name: call-n; judgement call
example.text: Since we have to use a survey -LRB- it 's just not possible to do a full count every month -RRB- , any subjectivity will increase our error , so we have to avoid any possible overlaps or judgement calls .

example.name: call-n; LV with arg2
example.text: Although I'm not a huge fan of that functionality (yeah, I like guns that can shoot as far as I can see), the developers made the call that a bullet wouldn't be able to reach fom one side of the screen to the other.
example.arg: Although I'm not a huge fan of that functionality
that a bullet wouldn't be able to reach from one side of the screen to the other

roleset.name: call (the shots); decide, dictate, officiate
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: Roleset broadened based on BOLT. (from call-v.11)

role.descr: entity in charge, official decision maker

example.name: call-v: I'm in charge!
example.text: The changes were proposed in an effort to streamline federal bureaucracy and boost compliance by the executives ``who [*T*-1] are really calling the shots,'' said Brian Lane, special counsel at the SEC's office of disclosure policy, which proposed the changes.

example.name: call-v: call a game
example.text: Maybe it was the umpires who-1 [*-1] called the game in his favor.

example.name: call-v: Call the vote
example.text: Seconds before we call the vote to kick them out of power , the fire alarm goes off again .
example.arg: the vote to kick them out of power

roleset.name: call someone out on something (non-VPC version)
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from call-v.13)

role.descr: accusation, thing called out (bluff, foul, bullshit, etc)

example.name: call-v: bring one's bluff to an end
example.text: Christie is being set up on this one and the legislature called his bluff

example.name: call-v: All args, oblique arg1
example.text: So what should I-1 do.. *PRO*-1 call him on his Bluff that he has an attorney that his whole family pitched in for and just file the papers how i want them
example.arg: on his Bluff that he has an attorney that his whole family pitched in for

example.name: call-v: All args, core arg 1. Call foul.
example.text: In golf ... you-1 got *PRO*-1 ta call fouls on yourself . And golfers do !

example.name: call-v: all args, call bullshit
example.text: The President of the executive body openly started threatening and intimidating people who-1 *trace*-1 were calling them on their bullshit .

roleset.name: claim (like dibs)
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: Added by Julia in tandem with call.13, based on BOLT. (from former call-v.14)

example.name: call-v: call shotgun
example.text: If you call shotgun, you get the privilege to sit in the passenger seat in front, next to the driver.

example.name: call-v: call dibs
example.text: Evan already called dibs on this guitar.

roleset.name: visit
roleset.note: CALL-N NOTES: Added by Julia (from call-n.16)
CALL-V NOTES: Added by Julia during unification.

example.name: call-n: all args, LVC
example.text: While I was covering for one of the other pediatricians, I made a house call on a child with a draining ear.
example.arg: While I was covering for one of the other pediatricians
on a child with a draining ear

example.name: call-v
example.text: She came to the conclusion that her circle of friends was a very dull one, and that no one who was a bit nice ever called on her at home.
example.arg: no one who was a bit nice

roleset.name: summon
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: (from call-v.08)

example.name: call_up-v: without benefactive
example.text: The bells called up the faithful to evensong

example.name: call_up-v: with benefactive
example.text: John called up a doctor for Mary

roleset.name: summon
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: This is phrasal, otherwise identical to 'summon' roleset. (from call-v.04)

example.name: call_in-v: with benefactive
example.text: John called in a doctor for Mary

roleset.name: visit, make use of
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: (from call-v.05)

example.name: call_on-v: with benefactive
example.text: John called on a doctor.

example.name: call_on-v: with secondary predication
example.text: Rep. Neal's bill originally called on the Fed [*-1] to reduce the inflation rate by one percentage point a year for five years and to maintain a zero inflation rate thereafter.
example.arg: [*-1] to reduce the inflation rate by one percentage point a year for five years and to maintain a zero inflation rate thereafter.

roleset.name: terminate before hand
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: (from call-v.06)

example.name: call_off-v: call off talks
example.text: Boeing Co., already struck by its Machinists union, briefly called off contract talks with its engineers and labeled their demands ``grossly excessive.''
example.arg: Boeing Co., already struck by its Machinists union

roleset.name: visit, make use of
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: Same as "call on" call.05 (from call-v.12)

role.descr: purpose of arg1, called upon to do what?

example.name: call_upon-v: Passive
example.text: However , he never imagined that the role whnp-1 he-2 was called upon *-2 *PRO* to play *t*-1 would be so lonely and dismal .

roleset.name: call someone out on something (VPC version)
roleset.note: CALL-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. Corresponds to call-v.13 (from call-v.15)

role.descr: accusation, what arg2 is called out on

example.name: call_out-v: Args 0, 1
example.text: Often these people would decry the " PC liberal media " for *PRO* not calling it out . (

frameset.note: AMR annotates "call into question" as question-03.
